intro: Atalaya coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf atalaya, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
